name: sh2peaks
description:
Extract the peaks of a spherical harmonic function in each voxel.

Peaks of the spherical harmonic function in each voxel are located by commencing a Newton search along each of a set of pre-specified directions

The spherical harmonic coefficients are stored according the conventions described the main documentation, which can be found at the following link: 
https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/3.0.4/concepts/spherical_harmonics.html

References:

Jeurissen, B.; Leemans, A.; Tournier, J.-D.; Jones, D.K.; Sijbers, J. Investigating the prevalence of complex fiber configurations in white matter tissue with diffusion magnetic resonance imaging. Human Brain Mapping, 2013, 34(11), 2747-2766
author: J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com)

inputs.name: SH
inputs.description: the input image of SH coefficients.

inputs.name: output
inputs.description: the output image. Each volume corresponds to the x, y & z component of each peak direction vector in turn.

inputs.name: num
inputs.description: the number of peaks to extract (default: 3).

inputs.name: direction
inputs.description: the direction of a peak to estimate. The algorithm will attempt to find the same number of peaks as have been specified using this option.

type.name: direction
type.description: the direction of a peak to estimate. The algorithm will attempt to find the same number of peaks as have been specified using this option.

inputs.name: phi
inputs.description: the direction of a peak to estimate. The algorithm will attempt to find the same number of peaks as have been specified using this option.

inputs.name: theta
inputs.description: the direction of a peak to estimate. The algorithm will attempt to find the same number of peaks as have been specified using this option.

inputs.name: peaks
inputs.description: the program will try to find the peaks that most closely match those in the image provided.

inputs.name: threshold
inputs.description: only peak amplitudes greater than the threshold will be considered.

inputs.name: seeds
inputs.description: specify a set of directions from which to start the multiple restarts of the optimisation (by default, the built-in 60 direction set is used)

inputs.name: mask
inputs.description: only perform computation within the specified binary brain mask image.

inputs.name: fast
inputs.description: use lookup table to compute associated Legendre polynomials (faster, but approximate).

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.

output-files.name: output
output-files.description: the output image. Each volume corresponds to the x, y & z component of each peak direction vector in turn.
